metadata.title: CVE-2021-45910 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in gif2apng 1.9. There is a heap-based bufferoverflow within the main function. It allows an attacker to write dataoutside of the allocated buffer. The attacker has control over a part ofthe address that data is written to, control over the written data, and (tosome extent) control over the amount of data that is written.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gif2apng - 1.9+srconly-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gif2apng package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9+srconly-3ubuntu0.1').
